channel.title: fossil on Barefoot Rob
channel.description: Recent content in fossil on Barefoot Rob

item.title: git out
item.description: 00:15 Thursday 19 April 2018 JST 39c7bfa recent entries 17a339c removed : from titles 70ec6d3 TEMPoRARY commit, not including all years, and not cleaned up filenames 6086901 Added README 354c77e (bitbucket/master) p 1fbcd35 s c385ebb colon 492f2fc slash 3b91dec slash 40ba10c w ce5271f w 8be74d2 w afebd29 dot The above shows a weird thing that happened to my git repo while I was messing with Fossil. The commit 6086901 is the first, and the commit 354c77e is the last, but it was shown right in a row.

item.title: might try to set up Fossil on Dreamhost
item.description: 11:30 Sunday 15 April 2018 JST I found an article about setting up Fossil on Dreamhost, and may try to go through it today. First, I will set up a new sub-domain and new user on Dreamhost. 12:07 Done. I recognize that I am using git on a server for Fossil, but am going to ignore that for now. Though the previous article compiled from source, it appears Fossil provides Linux binaries now.

item.title: wow wow fossil is awesome
item.description: 10:58 Wednesday 11 April 2018 JST Fossil is awesome, but I am not ready to switch quite yet. Can I get Fossil to host my journal like I have Hugo doing now? Should I? The point was to have it as a static site, so I guess not, but it seems weird to use something that can host sites just to track the site content and not host the site.
